Open source wallet and secure VPN platform Enter PIN Anonymous User ID (AUID) generates a unique identity to users Create your AUID OR Already have an account?
Restore your Keystore File Enter Password to Create AUID Confirm Password Next Copy your private key and keystore file to some secured place.
We do not store any of your keys in our databases.
If you lose them, you would not be able to access your account. Your Address Private Key Your keystore file is stored at Yes, I have copied my keys in a secured place Re-Enter PIN Restore Enter Keystore Password VPN TESTNET Test Mode %1s Transaction History VPN History Reset PIN Help Disconnect VIEW VPNs Make Payment Please go ahead and pay for the previous session to connect to VPN.
If you have already paid, Please wait for a couple of minutes, or you can report the payment View List View Map Connect to VPN Connect Total SENT Tokens Total Test SENT Tokens Total ETH Total Test ETH Send Send To Enter Amount Gas Limit Select Token From To Transaction Hash Amount Gas Price Total SENTs Paid Total Duration Total Received Data Session ID Received Data Duration Report Save Reset Enter Old PIN Enter New PIN Re-Enter New PIN Create User ID No internet connectivity. Please try again. Password and Confirm Password did not match Please Note Secure Keys Storage permission not granted. Private Key copied to clipboard Address copied to clipboard Transaction Hash copied to clipboard Set App PIN Pin and Confirm Pin did not match Invalid PIN. Please try again. Restore Keystore File Select a File File uploaded successfully Wallet Please enter the app PIN Activated Deactivated Wallet Balance Free test SENT tokens getting mined. You will receive them in your wallet soon. Yay! Thanks - Forgot PIN? PIN reset successful App PIN entered is wrong %d Gwei Copy Address Receive Payment pending for this session %1s SENTs %1s ETH Pay %1s SENTs %1s, %2s IP 	 %1s Bandwidth 	 %s Price(SENTs/GB) 	 %s Latency 	 %s %.2f Mbps %.0f SENTs %.3f ms Please wait. Loading… Creating a new account. Please wait… Setting up app PIN. Please wait… Restoring account. Please wait… Verifying credentials. Please wait… Resetting app PIN. Please wait… 42000 21000 Sending… Validating & signing transaction. Please wait… 100 Initial Payment Reminder Payment is being processed, please wait a couple of minutes before you connect to the VPN Inorder to use VPN, you need to pay 100 SENTs for the first time.

If you have already paid, please wait a couple of minutes before you connect to the VPN. Transaction placed… Check status Select VPN VPN Connections City: %1s Country: %1s Bandwidth: %1s Latency: %1s Price (SENTs / GB): %1s Coming soon… Fetching VPN configurations… Saving VPN configurations… Download Speed Data Used Upload Speed VPN Status: %1sring> You have already connected to a VPN server. Please disconnect from it before connecting to a new VPN server. Pending payment for previous session Amount Owed Below recommended level Estimate: Normal (< 5 mins to confirm) Estimate: Fast (< 2 mins to confirm) Estimate: Fastest (1–2 Blocks to confirm) Session Cost VPN Session Details Reporting VPN payment… Pay Loading Transaction History… Send ETH Receive ETH + %1s - %1s Status: Success Status: Fail Send SENT Receive SENT Transaction Details View on Etherscan Telegram https://t.me/sentinelsecuritygroup Medium Twitter Website https://medium.com/@Sentinel https://twitter.com/SentinelGroupio https://sentinelgroup.io/ This data will be added soon. FAQ Check for Updates Social Links Got it Scan results not found. The scanned result is not an Account Address. Discarding scanned results. Retry No VPN history found in MAINNET. No VPN nodes available in MAINNET, switch to TESTNET. No Transaction History found in MAINNET. Tap here to upload your Keystore file Logout Logging out will clear your keystore file, make sure you have saved it. Language Select Language View Tx History for Payment Done Successfully

Fetching VPN server credentials… Connection statistics Ongoing statistics of the established OpenVPN connection Connection status change Status changes of the OpenVPN connection (Connecting, authenticating,…) Connecting to VPN… Icon of app trying to use OpenVPN for Android By proceeding, you are giving the application permission to completely control OpenVPN for Android and to intercept all network traffic.Do NOT accept unless you trust the application. Otherwise, you run the risk of having your data compromised by malicious software." I trust this application. %1$s attempts to control %2$s No error found Pausing connection in screen off state: less than %1$s in %2$ss Warning: Persistent tun not enabled for this VPN. Traffic will use the normal Internet connection when the screen is off. Network Status: %s Reread (%d) log items from log cache file %10$s %9$s running on %3$s %1$s (%2$s), Android %6$s (%7$s) API %4$d, ABI %5$s, (%8$s) official build debug build built by %s Waiting %ss seconds between connection attempt Using proxy %1$s %2$d Password Authentication failed %.0f bit/s %.1f kbit/s %.1f Mbit/s %.1f Gbit/s %.0f B %.1f kB %.1f MB %.1f GB VPN permission revoked by OS (e.g. other VPN program started), stopping VPN %1$s - %2$s Not connected Restarting OpenVPN Service (App crashed probably crashed or killed for memory pressure) Building configuration… Opening tun interface: Refusing to open tun device without IP information Could not add DNS Server "%1$s", rejected by the system: %2$s Could not configure IP Address "%1$s", rejected by the system: %2$s Ignoring multicast route: %s Route rejected by Android Local IPv4: %1$s/%2$d IPv6: %3$s MTU: %4$d DNS Server: %1$s, Domain: %2$s Routes: %1$s %2$s Routes excluded: %1$s %2$s VpnService routes installed: %1$s %2$s %1$s - %2$s %1$s - %3$s, %2$s No DNS servers being used. Name resolution may not work. Consider setting custom DNS Servers. Please also note that Android will keep using your proxy settings specified for your mobile/Wi-Fi connection when no DNS servers are set. Failed to open the tun interface "Error: " On some custom ICS images the permission on /dev/tun might be wrong, or the tun module might be missing completely. For CM9 images try the fix ownership option under general settings Package %s is no longer installed, removing it from app allow/disallow list No allowed app added. Adding ourselves (%s) to have at least one app in the allowed app list to not allow all apps Disallowed VPN apps: %1$s Allowed VPN apps: %1$s Cannot make sense of %1$s and %2$s as IP route with CIDR netmask, using /32 as netmask. Corrected route %1$s/%2$s to %3$s/%2$s Got interface information %1$s and %2$s, assuming second address is peer address of remote. Using /32 netmask for local IP. Mode given by OpenVPN is "%3$s". Vpn topology "%3$s" specified but IP Config %1$s %2$s looks more like an IP address with a network mask. Assuming "subnet" topology. ↓:%2$s(%1$s)-↑:%4$s(%3$s) Not running OpenVPN crashed unexpectedly. Error getting proxy settings: %s Preferred native ABI precedence of this device (%1$s) and ABI reported by native libraries (%2$s) mismatch %3$s: %1$s

%2$s Unhandled exception: %1$s

%2$s Unknown state Connecting Waiting for server reply Authenticating Getting client configuration Assigning IP addresses Adding routes Connected Disconnect Reconnecting Exiting Resolving host names Connecting (TCP) Waiting for usable network VPN paused - screen off VPN pause requested by user Cannot display certificate information Cannot access the Android Keychain Certificates. This can be caused by a firmware upgrade or by restoring a backup of the app/app settings. Please edit the VPN and reselect the certificate under basic settings to recreate the permission to access the certificate. Some versions of Android 4.1 have problems if the name of the keystore certificate contains non alphanumeric characters (like spaces, underscores or dashes). Try to reimport the certificate without special characters No CA Certificate returned while reading from Android keystore. Authentication will probably fail. You must select a User certificate You must select a CA certificate KeyChain Access error: %s Config uses option tls-remote that was deprecated in 2.3 and finally removed in 2.4 Error parsing the IPv4 address Profile specified in shortcut not found Waiting for user permission to use VPN API Waiting for user VPN password VPN API permission dialog cancelled.

Please grant this permission to use VPN services If you did not get a VPN confirmation dialog, you have "Always on VPN" enabled for another app. In that case only that app is allowed to connect to a VPN. Check under Settings-> Networks more .. -> VPNS Error in Configuration Your image does not support the VPNService API. Error parsing the custom routes tls-auth file is missing Missing user certificate or user certifcate key file Missing CA certificate You need to define and enable at least one remote server. PKCS12 File Encryption Key Private Key Password Error signing with Android keystore key %1$s: %2$s
